column4: how do i get the latest kernel when synaptic only shows 2.4.x.x kernels
what version of ubuntu are you using?
did you upgrade from something to get there?
do this, lab_release -d and give the reply please
in terminal
yes
says command not found
correction >>  lsb_release -d  << sorry
do uname -a and I think you will find that you have a 2.6 kernel running
so your running the latest
why is this slow
power of processor, network connection something else, your not saying what is slow
ubuntu it self......i was running kde 3.5.3 in mandriva 2006 4 times faster then im runing gnome in ubuntu...
ask in #kubuntu I guess they know the most about kubuntu - could be eye candy issues or maybe something else
im not runing kubuntu..im runing ubuntu with gnome...kde was in mandriva'
ahh, so I don't know, it should be faster, so what kind of proc have you got, what kind of video card, what kind of disks and how much room, and how much ram
p2 450...384 mb ram.... 128 mb nvidia geforce4.....120 gig hdd.....unbuntu....   /11 gig    /swap  1 gig /home 36 gig
you should use "xubuntu" for that - >> sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop << it will be a lot faster
ok
